thread.title: Zombie Apocalypse 2-mile fun run begins at 4 p.m. Sunday in Eagle-Vail
thread.title_full: Zombie Apocalypse 2-mile fun run begins at 4 p.m. Sunday in Eagle-Vail

author: Krista Driscoll
title: Zombie Apocalypse 2-mile fun run begins at 4 p.m. Sunday in Eagle-Vail
text: If you go … What: Zombie Apocalypse 2-Mile Fun-Run-For-Your-Life. When: Sunday, Oct. 11; check-in and registration begin at 3 p.m., and the race begins at 4 p.m. Where: Eagle-Vail Pavilion Park, 538 Eagle Drive, Eagle-Vail. Cost: $25. More information: Visit www.vailrec.com/eaglevail-zombie-apocalypse-run or contact Nancy Lindbloom with BMHS at nancy.lindbloom@eagleschools.net. Related Media Battle Mountain High School’s Future Business Leaders of America and the Vail Recreation District invite runners to “run for their lives” today during the Eagle-Vail Zombie Apocalypse 2-Mile Fun-Run-For-Your-Life. Participants in this 2-mile obstacle course can choose to be either a survivor or a brain-hungry zombie and will be forced to outwit, outrun and outlive each other in a race like no other. A Post-Apocalypse Party will follow the event, with food, music and prizes. Proceeds benefit Battle Mountain High School’s Future Business Leaders of America and the Eric Spry Memorial Scholarship Fund. Participation in the race — as either a zombie or a survivor — costs $25 on race day. Zombie runner registration and check-in will take place at 3 p.m. at the Eagle-Vail Pavilion Park, while survivor runner registration and check-in will take place at 3:30 p.m. at the Eagle-Vail Pavilion Park. The race will begin at 4 p.m. for ages 12 and younger and 4:15 p.m. for ages 13 and older. This is the final race of the VRD’s running race season. Throughout the summer, the VRD has offered more than 11 running races, from half marathons to 5Ks to fun runs, with thousands of runners from across Colorado, the nation and the world participating. VRD will kick off its 2016 running race season in March with the annual 10K and 5K Shamrock Shuffle snowshoe races, followed by the return of the La Sportiva Vail Mountain Trail Running Series in May.
